titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. John Payne, Indictment
CWG6769

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

body.p:
State of Kentucky, Fayette Circuit Court,
Special Chancery & Crim Term 1865, July 3rd/ 65,
Commonwealth of Kentucky Plaintiff
against } On Indictment
John Payne Defendant
The Commonwealth came by her attorney and the Defendant appeared and plead guilty to the charge contained in the Indictment, and acknowledged himself indebted to the Commonwelath in the sum of $500.
Wherefore with the assent of the atty for the plaintiff and by leave of the Court! It as ajudged that the Plaintiff recover of the Defendant, Five hundred dollars, and also her Costs herein expended.
It is further ordered that a Capias Profine issue upon the foregoing Judgment.
A Copy -- Att Jno B Norton C f C C

I know John B payne very well -- He is poor and I believe honest & tries hard to support his Mother. He has no means to deal Faro with & in this case only dealt a short time for another -- This Mr. Downey assures me is the state of fact I cordialy recommmend his release --

Fayette C Ct
Comth Kentucky
vs. Copy Judgt.
Payne John
$500
